metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11232 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The etm_setup_aux function in drivers/hwtracing/coresight/coresight-etm-perf.c in the Linux kernel before 4.10.2 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (panic) because a parameter is incorrectly used as a local variable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-lowlatency - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-extra-4.11.0-1009-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-1004-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-generic-lpae - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-4.10.0-27-lowlatency - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2
linux-image-extra-4.10.0-27-generic - 4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2

criterions.comment: linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-27.30~16.04.2').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
